result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley Walter Studtman

records.addlTxt: Bond refund Ck#033555, for $1,000.00 picked up in person by Amy S. @ C of C counter this date. cah
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:47 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Wesley Walter Studtman. Defendant Wesley Walter Studtman in court. Includes 22CM241, 22CM252, and 22CM330. Court reviews case. Atty Dolfi requests to set for PLEAS and requests bond modification. Court sets Pleas. Atty Dolfi makes bond argument. ADA Damrau takes no position. Court amends bond. Adjourned 11:54 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Includes 22CM252 and 22CM330

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 11:45 am.

3:13 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood and ADA Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Wesley Walter Studtman in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Wesley Walter Studtman. INCLUDES 22CM241 and 22CM330. ADA Smestad states that discovery has been provided. Atty. Satorius states DE is attending out-patient treatment, requests additional 45-60 days to allow DE to complete additional treatment. Court sets STC, possible plea. DE confirms address and phone number. Adjourned: 3:20 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Wesley Walter Studtman
Current: 1243 Hwy 35, Hudson, WI 54016 United States  (Effective: 06-13-2022)
Prior: 858 170th Ave, New Richmond, WI 54017 
Per bond signed by DE.  gll
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
SJN to EFV on record 6/13/22. kma

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Participate in Motivational Group and call 715-716-0920 within 24 hours.

02:06 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Wesley Walter Studtman appeared. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. State requests bond. Atty. Satorius makes bond argument. Court orders bond. Court administratively transfers to Branch 2. Court sets STC. Adjourned: 2:12 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
